sen.j: 木屋町通（きやまちどおり）は、京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: the Kiyamachi-dori Street is on of the major north-south running streets of Kyoto City.
Kiyamachi-dori Street is one of the major streets running north-south in Kyoto City.
Kiyamachi-dori Street is one of the major streets running north-south in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は二条通から南は七条通まで。
sen.e: It extends from the Nijo-dori Street in the north to the Shichijo-dori Stree in the south.
It extends from Nijo-dori Street in the north to Shichijo-dori Stree in the south.
It extends from Nijo-dori Street in the north to Shichijo-dori Street in the south.

sen.j: 先斗町の西にあり、高瀬川 (京都府)の東側に沿っている。
sen.e: Located west of Pontocho, it runs along the east side of the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto prefecture).
Located west of Pontocho, it runs along the east side of Takase-gawa River (Kyoto prefecture).
Located west of Pontocho, it runs along the east side of Takase-gawa River (Kyoto prefecture).

sen.j: 三条通から南では一部を除き高瀬川西岸に西木屋町通が並走する。
sen.e: South of the Sanjo-dori Street, the Nishi-kiyamachi-dori Street parallel it along the west side of the Takase-gawa River except for some areas.
South of Sanjo-dori Street, Nishi-kiyamachi-dori Street runs parallel to it on the west side of Takase-gawa River except for some areas.
South of Sanjo-dori Street, Nishi-kiyamachi-dori Street runs parallel to it on the west side of Takase-gawa River except for some areas.
History
History
History

sen.j: 慶長年間の角倉了以の高瀬川開削に伴って整備された。
sen.e: In the Keicho era, Ryoi SUMINOKURA developed it with the excavation of the Takase-gaw River.
In the Keicho era, Ryoi SUMINOKURA improved it with the excavation of the Takase-gawa River.
In the Keicho era, Ryoi SUMINOKURA improved it with the excavation of the Takase-gawa River.

sen.j: 開通当時は、「樵木町」（こりきまち）と呼ばれていたが、高瀬舟が運んでくる材木の倉庫が立ち並ぶようになったため、いつしか「木屋町」という名称に変わったという。
sen.e: The district along the street, when the street opened, was initially called "Korikimachi" but came to be called "Kiyamachi" after it was lined with many warehouses for lumber carried by ships called Takasebune.
sen.cmt: 主語として「沿道の地域」を加えました。http://kotobank.jp/word/高瀬舟
sen.e: The district along the street, when the street opened, was initially called "Korikimachi" but came to be called "Kiyamachi" after it was lined with many lumber warehouses which stored lumber carried by ships called Takasebune.

The district along the street, when the street opened, was initially called 'Korikimachi' but came to be called 'Kiyamachi' after it was lined with many lumber warehouses which stored lumber carried by ships called Takasebune.

sen.j: 木屋町周辺に残されている紙屋町、鍋屋町、米屋町などの地名は、当時の賑わいを彷彿させる。
sen.e: There still remain names such as Mamiyacho, Nabeya-cho, and Komeya-cho, which show how brisk busiensses are in those days.
Names such as Mamiyacho, Nabeya-cho, and Komeya-cho, still remain, which is evidence as to how brisk business used to be in those days.
Names such as Kamiyacho, Nabeya-cho, and Komeya-cho, still remain, which is evidence as to how brisk business used to be in those days.

sen.j: 江戸時代中頃にはこの通りを往来する旅人や商人を目当てに、料理屋や旅籠、酒屋などが店を構えるようになり、酒楼娯楽の場へと姿を変えた。
sen.e: In the mid-Edo era, restaurants, inns, liquar shops targeted at travellers and merchants started to be established along the street, making the district change into a place of restaurants andamusement.
In the mid-Edo era, restaurants, inns, liquor shops targeted at travellers and merchants started to be established along the street, changing the district into a restaurant and amusement area.
In the mid-Edo period, restaurants, inns, liquor shops targeted at travellers and merchants started to be established along the street, changing the district into a restaurant and amusement area.

sen.j: 幕末には勤皇志士が密会に利用したため、坂本龍馬や桂小五郎らの潜居跡や事跡の碑が繁華街のあちこちに立っている。
sen.e: Monuments showing the remains of refuge for Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kogoro KATSURA or assasinations are around along the street, because, at the end of Edo Era, loyal supporters of the Emperor used such inns for their secret meetings. Martyrs include Masujiro OMURA, Seiichiro HOMMA, and Shozan SAKUMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処勤皇志士 英辞郎 on the WEBhttp://kotobank.jp/word/桂小五郎http://kotobank.jp/word/大村益次郎http://kotobank.jp/word/本間精一郎http://kotobank.jp/word/佐久間象山
sen.e: At the end of Edo Era, loyal supporters of the Emperor used inns for their secret meetings and monuments which act as memorials for locations where Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kogoro KATSURA took refuge and were assassinated, can be found along the street. Martyrs include Masujiro OMURA, Seiichiro HOMMA, and Shozan SAKUMA.

At the end of the Edo period, loyal supporters of the Emperor used inns for their secret meetings and monuments which act as memorials for locations where Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kogoro KATSURA took refuge and were assassinated, can be found along the street.
sen.cmt: era→period一原文一訳文例外対処"the" を挿入

sen.j: 大村益次郎や本間精一郎、佐久間象山などが殉難している。
sen.e: Martyrs include Masujiro OMURA, Seiichiro HONMA, and Shozan SAKUMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処スペルを修正

sen.j: 1895年には二条通～五条通間に京都電気鉄道（のちに買収され京都市電）の路面電車が開通した。
sen.e: In 1895, trams of Kyoto Electric Railway (later Kyoto Municipal Steetcar) started to run between the Nijo-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: http://kaiwai.city.kyoto.jp/search/view_sight.php?ManageCode=3000043&InforKindCode=1&whole=tru京都電気鉄道 定訳不明京都市電 定訳不明
sen.e: In 1895, trams by the Kyoto Electric Railway (later Kyoto Municipal Steetcar) started to run between Nijo-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
In 1895, trams by the Kyoto Electric Railway (later Kyoto Municipal Streetcar) started to run between Nijo-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.

sen.j: 1920年代に河原町通が拡幅されたことにより、市電のルートはそちらに移った。
sen.e: In the 1920's, the rails for the trams was moved to the Kawaramachi-dori Street when it was widened.
In the 1920's, the rails for the trams were moved to Kawaramachi-dori Street when it was widened.
In the 1920's, the rails for the trams were moved to Kawaramachi-dori Street when it was widened.
Current Situations
Current Situation
Current situation

sen.j: 高瀬川の側にサクラが植栽され、歩道を場所により車道側に飛び出させて車の高速走行を押さえるなど、整備がされている。
sen.e: The street has been improved by planting cherry trees along the side of the Takase-gawa River and adopting the design of the sidewalk that protrudes into the lanes in places to make cars to slow down.
The street has been improved by planting cherry trees along the side of the Takase-gawa River and adopting a sidewalk design that protrudes into lanes in places in order to make cars slow down.
The street has been improved by planting cherry trees along the side of the Takase-gawa River and adopting a sidewalk design that protrudes into lanes in places in order to make cars slow down.

sen.j: 三条通から四条通までを中心に、スナック、料亭などに加え、各国料理レストランなど所狭しと並んでいる。
sen.e: The section between the Sanjo-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street is crammed with multinational restaurants as well as bar stools, high-class Japanese-style restaurant.
The section between Sanjo-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street is crammed with multinational restaurants as well as bars and high-class Japanese-style restaurants.
The section between Sanjo-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street is crammed with multinational restaurants as well as bars and high-class Japanese-style restaurants.

sen.j: 風俗営業店の増加に伴い、地元が治安対策の運動を行っている。
sen.e: With the increase of adult-entertainment businesses, the local community is taking securitiy measures.
With an increase in adult-entertainment businesses, the local community is taking securitiy measures.
With an increase in adult-entertainment businesses, the local community is taking security measures.
